titocc.compiler

Class Lvalue

  • java.lang.Object
    • titocc.compiler.Lvalue

  • public class Lvalue
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the result of evaluating an expression as lvalue. The purpose is to allow lvalue result to be either a variable reference or a pointer value in a register. However, even the lvalue is just a variable reference, a register still needs to be reserved for it in case the address is later needed in a register. loadAddressToRegister() method can be called to force loading of the address into a register

      • Lvalue

        public Lvalue(Register reservedRegister,
      java.lang.String reference)
        Constructs an named lvalue that can be accessed by assembly language reference (e.g. "myVar(fp)").
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • loadAddressToRegister

        public void loadAddressToRegister(Assembler asm)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the address of the object in the reserved register. If the address is already in the reserved register then does nothing.
        Parameters:
        asm - assembler used for emitting the load instruction
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the assembler throws

      • getRegister

        public Register getRegister()
        Returns the register reserved for the address of the lvalue.
        Returns:
        the reserved register

      • getReference

        public java.lang.String getReference()
        Returns a symbolic reference to the lvalue. If the lvalue is unnamed then it's referenced through the register (e.g. "0(R2)").
        Returns:
        the symbolic reference
